p: There is an apparent positive sensitivity between WR and precipitation with 0.614 mm/(mm·km 2) average sensitivity (Fig. 5c). 41.56% of the pixels showed a positive sensitivity, and only 0.43% of the pixels showed a negative sensitivity. Compared to the sensitivity of WR to precipitation, the sensitivity to temperature was generally negative (average: − 1.172 mm/ °C·km 2) (Fig. 5d). The high negative sensitivity was concentrated in the South of the study region like Nyingchi. There was a relatively low sensitivity between climate change and HQ (Fig. 5e, f). The average sensitivity of HQ to precipitation and temperature was − 4.85e− 05/mm km 2 and − 1.172 °C km 2, respectively. The regions sensitive to climate change were mainly concentrated in the southern and southeastern parts of the Tibetan Plateau.
